product_name: Taos Rock: Climbs and Boulders of Northern New Mexico
long_description: With over 300 days of sunshine a year, Northern New Mexico offers mild winter, cool summers, unrivaled sunsets and panoramic vistas. Author: Jay Foley. Softcover; 190 pages; black-and-white photos and route maps. Sharp End Publishing; copyright 2005. Crank steep bolted cobbles amid the pine forests of El Rito and sample the splitter cracks and bolted basalt of the Rio Grande Corridor. Multi-pitch trad climbing provides day-long adventure on Questa Dome and many fine bouldering areas serve as destinations or quick fixes. Tres Piedras, Cimarron and Comale Canyons, round out the offerings. Free camping, hot springs and uncrowded cliffs combine with Southwestern charm to make Taos the ultimate Four Corners climbing destination.
short_description: With over 300 days of sunshine a year, Northern New Mexico offers mild winter, cool summers, unrivaled sunsets and panoramic vistas.
